intro: Pseudognaphalium sonorae, commonly known as the Sonoran goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and grasslands, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Pseudognaphalium sonorae is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
